Method Detail

load

public static java.util.Vector load(java.util.Vector configSet)
                             throws java.lang.Exception
Load and configure objects specified in a configuration set. The method sequences thru a Vector of object specifications and attempts to instantiate the specified objects.

Each item in the configuration set vector is expected to be an ArgArray of name/value pairs. The following name/value pairs are currently supported by StartupInit. Any other object initialization settings are passed directly to the configure method of the object and should utilize a convention of ClassName.propertyName where ClassName is the className of the object being created and propertyName is the name of the property being specified. For example, "Entity.description" would specify the description property for the Entity class. As a special case, any instance name specified as "" or "NCAP" will refer to the NCAP. This allows references to the NCAP be made without knowing its name.

Condition tests can be inverted by setting invert=false inside a condition. e.g. true.
Name Default Description
instanceName   The name of the object to create. If the object already exists with the indicated name then this item is skipped. This item is required.
className   The full class name of the object. This item is required.
register true Optional. true causes the new object to be registered with the NCAP.
destroy false Optional. true causes any objects with the specified name to be destroyed.
condition none Optional. An ArgArray that specifies conditions for creating the object. If any of the conditions specified fail, the object is not created or destroyed. Please refer to the ConditionEval class for details. The following is a subset of the conditions supported.

Condition value Description
prop type=property A field that defines this as a property conditions.
  name=property name The System.getProperty(java.lang.String) method is used to look up the named property. If value is set then a check is made to see if the property contains the string specified by value.
  value= A string to match against the System.getProperty lookup specified by the prop field.
object object=prop A field that defines this as a object existance condition.
  object=The object with the specified name is checked for existance.

Parameters:
configSet - of configuration information.
Returns:
A Vector of created objects.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

destroyObject

public static void destroyObject(java.lang.String instanceName)

createObject

public static java.lang.Object createObject(java.lang.String className,
                                            java.lang.String instanceName,
                                            boolean register)
Create new object method. This method instantiates new objects and optionlly registers them by name with the NCAP.

Parameters:
className - Name of class to instantiate
instanceName - Name of the new instance
register - true if the object should be registered with the NCAP.
Returns:
Object: null indicates instantiation problem

createAndConfig

public static java.lang.Object createAndConfig(java.lang.String className,
                                               java.lang.String instanceName,
                                               ArgArray configuration,
                                               boolean register)
Create new object and configure it. This method instantiates new objects, optionally registers them by name with the NCAP, and invokes their configure method.

Parameters:
className - Name of class to instantiate
instanceName - Name of the new instance
configuration - ArgArray of configuration parameters.
register - True if the object should be registered with the NCAP
Returns:
Object: null indicates instantiation problem
